abstracts.cdata!:
The Public Expenditure Reform Loan
            Project will support the Government's program, as
            articulated in the Economic Agenda for the New Millennium
            (NEA), and the accompanying public finance reform. It will
            finance specific actions taken by the Government during
            budget year 2001/2002, and in particular, will focus on key
            reforms in education, training, poverty alleviation,
            environment, and economic management. Complementary
            knowledge assistance will concentrate on human capital
            development, and economic management. The project will be
            beneficial in implementing, and sustaining the
            Government's reform program that focuses on
            transforming Mauritius into a "high-tech high income
            service and knowledge economy" over the medium term.
            However, the shortfall of political support in implementing
            reforms, uncertainty about the Government's
            achievements in meeting deficit targets, and, the public
            sector's capacity constraints in technical knowledge,
            are potential risks which should be mitigated by consensus
            building, continued dialogue, and assisting the Government
            in institutionalizing a medium-term macroeconomic framework,
            and, strengthening relevant technical and managerial capacity.
